model module¶

The Person Finder data model, based on PFIF (http://zesty.ca/pfif).

class model.Base(parent=None, key_name=None, _app=None, _from_entity=False, **kwds)¶

Bases: google.appengine.ext.db.Model

Base class providing methods common to both Person and Note entities, whose key names are partitioned using the repo name as a prefix.

FETCH_LIMIT = 200¶
classmethod all(keys_only=False, filter_expired=True)¶

Returns a query for all records of this kind; by default this filters out the records marked as expired.

Args:
keys_only - If true, return only the keys. filter_expired - If true, omit records with is_expired == True.
Returns:
query - A Query object for the results.
classmethod all_in_repo(repo, filter_expired=True)¶

Creates a new original entity with the given field values.

classmethod create_original_with_record_id(repo, record_id, **kwargs)¶

Creates an original entity with the given record_id and field values, overwriting any existing entity with the same record_id. This should be rarely used in practice (e.g. for an administrative import into a home repository), hence the long method name.

classmethod get(repo, record_id, filter_expired=True)¶

class model.Counter(parent=None, key_name=None, _app=None, **kwds)¶

Bases: google.appengine.ext.db.Expando

Counters hold partial and completed results for ongoing counting tasks. To see how this is used, check out tasks.py. A single Counter object can contain several named accumulators. Typical usage is to scan for entities in order by __key__, update the accumulators for each entity, and save the partial counts when the time limit for a request is reached. The last scanned key is saved in last_key so the next request can pick up the scan where the last one left off. A non-empty last_key means a scan is not finished; when a scan is done, last_key should be set to ‘’.

classmethod all_finished_counters(repo, scan_name)¶

Gets a query for all finished counters for the specified scan.

get(count_name)¶

Gets the specified accumulator from this counter object.

classmethod get_all_counts(repo, scan_name)¶

Gets a dictionary of all the counts for the last completed scan for the given repository and scan name.

classmethod get_count(repo, name)¶

Gets the latest finished count for the given repository and name. ‘name’ should be in the format scan_name + ‘.’ + count_name.

classmethod get_unfinished_or_create(repo, scan_name)¶

Gets the latest unfinished Counter entity for the given repository and scan_name. If there is no unfinished Counter, create a new one.

increment(count_name)¶

Increments the given accumulator on this Counter object.

last_key¶

A textual property, which can be multi- or single-line.

repo¶

A textual property, which can be multi- or single-line.

scan_name¶

A textual property, which can be multi- or single-line.

timestamp¶

The base class of all of our date/time properties.

We handle common operations, like converting between time tuples and datetime instances.

class model.Person(parent=None, key_name=None, _app=None, _from_entity=False, **kwds)¶

Bases: model.Base

The datastore entity kind for storing a PFIF person record. Never call Person() directly; use Person.create_clone() or Person.create_original().

Methods that start with “get_” return actual values or lists of values; other methods return queries or generators for values.

get_effective_expiry_date()¶

Gets the expiry_date, or if no expiry_date is present, returns the source_date plus the configurable default_expiration_days interval.

If there’s no source_date, we use original_creation_date. Returns:

A datetime date (not None).

update_latest_status(modified_note=None)¶

Scans all notes on this Person and fixes latest_status if needed.

wipe_contents()¶

Sets all the content fields to None (leaving timestamps and the expiry flag untouched), stores the empty record, and permanently deletes any related Notes and Photos. Call this method ONLY on records that have already expired.

class model.Repo(parent=None, key_name=None, _app=None, _from_entity=False, **kwds)¶

Bases: google.appengine.ext.db.Model

Identifier for a repository of Person and Note records. This is a top-level entity, with no parent, whose existence just indicates the existence of a repository. Key name: unique repository name. In the UI, each repository behaves like an independent instance of the application.

classmethod list()¶

Returns a list of all repository names.

classmethod list_active()¶

Returns a list of the active (non-deactivated) repository names.

classmethod list_launched()¶

Returns a list of the launched (listed in menu) repository names.

model.clone_to_new_type(origin, dest_class, **kwargs)¶

Clones the given entity to a new entity of the type “dest_class”. Optionally, pass in values to kwargs to update values during cloning.

model.encode_count_name(count_name)¶

Encode a name to printable ASCII characters so it can be safely used as an attribute name for the datastore.

model.filter_by_prefix(query, key_name_prefix)¶

Filters a query for key_names that have the given prefix. If root_kind is specified, filters the query for children of any entities that are of that kind with the given prefix; otherwise, the results are assumed to be top-level entities of the kind being queried.

model.get_properties_as_dict(db_obj)¶

Returns a dictionary containing all (dynamic)* properties of db_obj.

model.is_clone(repo, record_id)¶

Returns True if this is a record_id for a clone record (a record created in another repository and copied into the specified one).

model.is_original(repo, record_id)¶

Returns True if this is a record_id for a record originally created in the specified repository.
